us.conxio.HL7.HL7Stream
Class HL7Server

java.lang.Object
  us.conxio.HL7.HL7Stream.HL7Server
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, HL7Stream
public class HL7Server
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, HL7Stream

A thread pooled HL7 Server. Hacked off of Jakob Jenkov's thread pooled server example.

Field Summary
protected  boolean isStopped
          A flag to indicate the run status of the server.
protected  HL7MessageHandler msgHandler
          The class that handles the message.
protected  int poolSize
          The number of threads for the server to maintain in it's pool of available running threads.
protected  java.lang.Thread runningThread
          A refrence to the currently running thread.
protected  int serverPort
          The port at which the server will listen for connection requests.
protected  java.net.ServerSocket serverSock
          The socket which the server uses to accept connection requests.
protected  java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService threadPool
          A reference to the pool of available threads.
 
Fields inherited from interface us.conxio.HL7.HL7Stream.HL7Stream

Constructor Detail

HL7Server

public HL7Server(int port,
                 int poolSize)
Create an instance of the thread pooled server, assuming that the host is localhost.

Parameters:
port - The port no. for the server to listen on for connection requests.
poolSize - The desired thread pool size

HL7Server

public HL7Server(int port,
                 int poolSize,
                 HL7MessageHandler handler)
Create a thread pooled server, with localhost as host, registering the argument handler.

Parameters:
port - The port no. for the server to listen on for connection requests.
poolSize - The desired thread pool size
handler - The dispatch handler for incoming HL7Message objects.

HL7Server

public HL7Server(java.net.URI uri)
Create a HL7 server from the argument URI.

Parameters:
uri - the argument URI.

run

public void run()
The required run method for the server thread, which accepts connection requests, and hands them off to HL7ServiceWorker instances in the thread pool.
